meanings.definition: To breathe in air or another substance
meanings.sent1: I inhale deeply before blowing out the candles on my birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: Remember to inhale slowly and steadily during yoga practice.
meanings.sent3: As a joke, he tried to inhale the entire sandwich in one breath.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the forest made me want to inhale its fresh, pine-scented air.
meanings.sent5: She closed her eyes to inhale the aroma of freshly baked cookies.

meanings.sent1: The vacuum cleaner can inhale all the dust and dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent2: The singer paused to inhale deeply before hitting the high note.
meanings.sent3: He pretended to inhale the helium from the balloon and spoke in a funny voice.
meanings.sent4: The black hole seemed to inhale all the light around it, creating a mysterious effect.
meanings.sent5: The powerful storm seemed to inhale everything in its path, leaving destruction behind.
